name: parisian_artists_future_2026
context: A psychometric survey of the Parisian artistic community in 2026, two years after the widespread adoption of advanced generative AI models. As traditional artistic hubs like Montmartre and Le Marais grapple with the digitization of aesthetics, this instrument assesses the tension between human craftsmanship and algorithmic output. It explores how working artists perceive the ontological status of AI-generated works and their fears or hopes regarding the economic viability of human-made art.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on the nature of art in this new digital era, please indicate how much {player_name} agrees with the following:
questions.statement: An image generated by an algorithm lacks the 'soul' or emotional depth that defines true artistic expression.

questions.preprompt: Considering the definition of creativity, what is {player_name}'s stance on this statement?
questions.statement: Even if an AI creates something beautiful, it cannot be considered art because there was no human intent behind its inception.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about the value of human touch in art, to what extent does {player_name} agree?
questions.statement: An artwork created entirely by AI is just as legitimate and meaningful as a painting created by a human master.

questions.preprompt: Regarding {player_name}'s financial future as an artist in Paris, please rate the following statement:
questions.statement: It is becoming impossible for human artists to compete with the speed and low cost of AI generation.

questions.preprompt: How does {player_name} feel about the market for traditional art forms right now?
questions.statement: {player_name} fears that galleries and patrons will soon stop valuing the premium cost of human labor.

questions.preprompt: Considering the economic landscape of the art world in 2026, to what extent does {player_name} agree?
questions.statement: There will always be a stable and lucrative market for authentic, human-made art, regardless of AI capabilities.

questions.preprompt: When thinking about using new tools in the studio, how does {player_name} respond to this idea?
questions.statement: Using generative AI as a starting point for sketches or ideas enhances {player_name}'s creative process.

questions.preprompt: Regarding the integration of technology into artistic practice, to what extent does {player_name} agree?
questions.statement: AI models should be viewed as sophisticated paintbrushes rather than as replacements for the artist.

questions.preprompt: How does {player_name} feel about incorporating algorithmic output into their work?
questions.statement: {player_name} would refuse to use AI tools in their artistic workflow, even if it saved significant time.
